titles.title: Senior Housing Commission Extension Act of 2001
Senior Housing Commission Extension Act of 2001
To extend the Commission on Affordable Housing and Health Facility Needs for Seniors in the 21st Century and to make technical corrections to the law governing the Commission.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Housing and Community Opportunity.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Financial Services. H. Rept. 107-147.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 85.

action.text: Mr. Green (WI) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1850.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

committee.name: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

bill.summary: 7/19/2001--Reported to House without amendment. Senior Housing Commission Extension Act of 2001 - Amends the Departments of Veterans Affairs and Housing and Urban Development, and Independent Agencies Appropriations Act, 2000 to extend: (1) the Commission on Affordable Housing and Health Care Facility Needs in the 21st Century to March 31, 2003; and (2) the Commission reporting date to December 31, 2002.Provides for the detailing of Federal personnel to the Commission on a non-reimbursable (currently reimbursable) basis.
